title: Are recyclable party dresses really the solution to the fast fashion problem?
text:
It’s almost party season which, in the fashion world, is a time for sartorial excess. Sequins, which are plastic! Glitter, which is plastic! Polyester dresses, which are plastic! It is also the peak occasion to buy a new outfit that you’ll only ever wear once, before throwing it away.

One company believes it has a new solution, to offset the environmental impact caused by its annual rush of particularly fast-fashion-hungry customers. Little Mistress, the London-based retailer and self-proclaimed ‘haven of exclusive partywear’, has this week launched a capsule collection of recycled and recyclable party dresses.

Brand patrons like the Love Island contestant Zara McDermott and influencer Amy Neville...
